company_rating: Utah.   The Primary Children’s Hospital Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is the only Level IV NICU in the Intermountain West and one of the nation’s busiest.  It serves fragile newborns from Utah
company_link: covering one of the largest geographic areas of any children’s hospitals in the nation. apply_link: Neurological and VLBW and ECMO care for the variety of patients we see. There are many opportunities for advancement and learning here. jobid: DaVita is seeking a Patient Care Technician who is looking to give life in an outpatient dialysis center. company_name: compassionate way - the way you'd want your own care to be?   If you haven't considered Nephrology before

description_text: you will gain the skills needed to care for our patients and build a network of other health care professionals across the geography where you live. Once you have successfully completed training
benefits: you will join a holistic team of care professionals – including nurses
location: and other experienced PCTs – to care for our patients. It's not a job
salary_formatted: it's giving life and a career based on passion and purpose.   DaVita – which is Italian for ""giving life"" – is working to provide quality service to patients
company_reviews_count: and teammates. Our mission is to be the Provider
date_posted: and Employer of Choice.   Our PCTs also find DaVita professionally fulfilling. To help advance your career
description: we offer clear paths to higher levels of responsibility and compensation through our Clinical Ladders program. Through DaVita's Bridge to your Dreams program
region: teammates who have been in their role for six consecutive months and in good standing
company_link: are eligible to receive tuition assistance up front to pursue their dream of becoming a DaVita RN and getting their Associates Degree in Nursing. We also have dedicated training to become a Facility Administrator
company_website: and training to become a Regional Operations Director. Your success is driven by your performance and desire.   Some details about this position:     No Dialysis experience is required.   Training may take place in a facility or a training clinic other than your assigned home clinic   Potential to float to various clinics during and after your training   You must have a flexible schedule and be able to work mornings
srcname: and holidays    What you can expect:     Direct Patient Care. Spend the majority of your day in direct one-on-one patient care to provide safe
url: comfortable and hygienic dialysis treatment.   Our PCTs care for multiple patients.   Technician Duties. To monitor patients before

jobid: What does a successful Senior Release Engineer do?   The role of the Release Manager is to support technical release process and serve in a governance role in support of the release management process. Roughly 25% of the time will be spent outside of normal business hours include supporting releases and deploys on overnight shifts.   What will you do?    Interface with internal teams across division to be engaged in release management activities.   Implement and improve the release management process.   Execute deployment and release activities.   Lead and co-ordinate go-live activities including execution of deployment plans and check lists.   Maintain and publish a release calendar.   Evaluate release risk and develop mitigation strategy with partner teams.   Governance of deployments in lower environments as part of the risk mitigation strategy.   Validation of playbooks for manual and automated use.   Partner with deploy resources to identify and implement automation opportunities in the deploy process.   Post release evaluation and operational improvement identification.   Maintain and report release metrics.   Maintain documentation of the production control environment.   Develop and maintain operational procedure Runbooks.   Generate change discrepancy reports
company_name: following up with project teams for remediation.   Create Releases
date_posted_parsed: Packages and Tasks for work assignment and tracking.   Plan
job_title: communicate and monitor release statuses. Identify and manage risks for projects as assigned.   Gain Release stakeholder consensus on release content and go/no go decisions.   Provide after-hours support to troubleshoot issues or execute deployment of Digital Channels managed services.    What will you need to have:    Bachelor’s Degree
description_text: preferably in Computer Science
benefits: Information Technology degree (or similar) or relevant work experience.   2-4 years of experience in release management.    What would be great to have:    Basic working knowledge of XML.   Understanding of ITIL framework.   Experience with Agile\Scrum Software Development Life Cycle methodologies.   Experience as part of a DevOps culture.   Working knowledge of online banking and mobile banking services and processes.   Competent in system administration (Windows preferred but other OS’s applicable).   Working knowledge of HTTP Servers.   1-2 years of experience with SQL Server.   Working knowledge of Server and Network infrastructure.   Project Management.   Strong analytical
qualifications: organizational and time management skills.   Solid verbal and written communication skills.   Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously.   Ability to develop necessary documentation for external support organizations.   Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems in a methodical fashion.   Client management and relationship building skills; experience with external clients preferred.   #LI-KP1   This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado
